verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought unto the priest:
verses.web: “This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest,
verses.ct: "Here is the procedure for someone with a skin disease on the day they are declared clean: They must be brought to the priest.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the priest shall look, and, behold, if the plague of leprosy be healed in the leper;
verses.web: and the priest shall go out of the camp. The priest shall examine him. Behold, if the plague of leprosy is healed in the leper,
verses.ct: The priest will go outside the camp and examine the person. If the skin disease has healed,

verses.kjv: Then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive and clean, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:
verses.web: then the priest shall command them to take for him who is to be cleansed two living clean birds, cedar wood, scarlet, and hyssop.
verses.ct: the priest will order that two live, clean birds be brought, along with cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel over running water:
verses.web: The priest shall command them to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.
verses.ct: The priest will have one of the birds killed over a clay pot filled with fresh running water.

verses.kjv: As for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water:
verses.web: As for the living bird, he shall take it, the cedar wood, the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them and the living bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
verses.ct: Then he will take the living bird, the cedar wood, the scarlet yarn, and the hyssop, and dip them all — including the living bird — into the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.

verses.kjv: And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose into the open field.
verses.web: He shall sprinkle on him who is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird go into the open field.
verses.ct: He will sprinkle the blood 7 times on the person being cleansed from the skin disease, declare them clean, and then release the living bird into the open field.

verses.kjv: And he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and after that he shall come into the camp, and shall tarry abroad out of his tent seven days.
verses.web: “He who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and bathe himself in water; and he shall be clean. After that he shall come into the camp, but shall dwell outside his tent seven days.
verses.ct: The person being cleansed must wash their clothes, shave off all their hair, and bathe in water. After that they will be clean and may return to the camp, but they must stay outside their tent for 7 days.

verses.kjv: But it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off: and he shall wash his clothes, also he shall wash his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.
verses.web: It shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head and his beard and his eyebrows, even all his hair he shall shave off. He shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his body in water. Then he shall be clean.
verses.ct: On the 7th day, they must shave off all their hair — their head, their beard, their eyebrows, every bit of hair on their body. They must wash their clothes and bathe in water. Then they will be clean.

verses.kjv: And on the eighth day he shall take two he lambs without blemish, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth deals of fine flour for a meat offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.
verses.web: “On the eighth day he shall take two male lambs without defect, one ewe lamb a year old without defect, three tenths of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering, mixed with oil, and one log of oil.
verses.ct: On the 8th day, they must bring 2 male lambs without any defect, one year-old female lamb without defect, 3 tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and one log of oil.

verses.kjv: And the priest that maketh him clean shall present the man that is to be made clean, and those things, before the LORD, at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.web: The priest who cleanses him shall set the man who is to be cleansed, and those things, before LORD, at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: The priest performing the cleansing will present the person and all these items before the LORD at the entrance to the Tabernacle.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take one he lamb, and offer him for a trespass offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave offering before the LORD:
verses.web: “The priest shall take one of the male lambs, and offer him for a trespass offering, with the log of oil, and wave them for a wave offering before LORD.
verses.ct: The priest will take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering, along with the log of oil, and wave them before the LORD as a wave offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall slay the lamb in the place where he shall kill the sin offering and the burnt offering, in the holy place: for as the sin offering is the priest’s, so is the trespass offering: it is most holy:
verses.web: He shall kill the male lamb in the place where they kill the sin offering and the burnt offering, in the place of the sanctuary; for as the sin offering is the priest’s, so is the trespass offering. It is most holy.
verses.ct: He will slaughter the lamb in the holy place where sin offerings and burnt offerings are killed. Like the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest — it is most holy.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:
verses.web: The priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and the priest shall put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
verses.ct: The priest will take some of the blood from the guilt offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of the person being cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand:
verses.web: The priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
verses.ct: Then the priest will take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD:
verses.web: The priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before LORD.
verses.ct: He will dip his right finger into the oil in his left hand and sprinkle some of it 7 times before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And of the rest of the oil that is in his hand shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering:
verses.web: The priest shall put some of the rest of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering.
verses.ct: From the oil remaining in his hand, the priest will put some on the tip of the right ear of the person being cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot — right on top of the blood from the guilt offering.

verses.kjv: And the remnant of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall pour upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD.
verses.web: The rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put on the head of him who is to be cleansed, and the priest shall make atonement for him before LORD.
verses.ct: Whatever oil is left in the priest's hand, he will pour on the head of the person being cleansed. In this way the priest will make atonement for them before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt offering:
verses.web: “The priest shall offer the sin offering, and make atonement for him who is to be cleansed because of his uncleanness. Afterward he shall kill the burnt offering;
verses.ct: Next, the priest will offer the sin offering and make atonement for the person being cleansed from their uncleanness. After that, he will slaughter the burnt offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meat offering upon the altar: and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
verses.web: then the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar. The priest shall make atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
verses.ct: The priest will offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar. Through this the priest will make atonement for the person, and they will be clean.

verses.kjv: And if he be poor, and cannot get so much; then he shall take one lamb for a trespass offering to be waved, to make an atonement for him, and one tenth deal of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat offering, and a log of oil;
verses.web: “If he is poor, and can’t afford so much, then he shall take one male lamb for a trespass offering to be waved, to make atonement for him, and one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering, and a log of oil;
verses.ct: "If the person is poor and can't afford all of this, they may bring one male lamb as a guilt offering to be waved for their atonement, along with one tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and a log of oil,

verses.kjv: And two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.
verses.web: and two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to afford; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.
verses.ct: plus 2 turtledoves or 2 young pigeons — whatever they can afford. One will serve as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall bring them on the eighth day for his cleansing unto the priest, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, before the LORD.
verses.web: “On the eighth day he shall bring them for his cleansing to the priest, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, before LORD.
verses.ct: On the 8th day, they must bring these to the priest at the entrance to the Tabernacle, before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the LORD:
verses.web: The priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before LORD.
verses.ct: The priest will take the lamb for the guilt offering and the log of oil and wave them before the LORD as a wave offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot:
verses.web: He shall kill the lamb of the trespass offering. The priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering and put it on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
verses.ct: He will slaughter the guilt offering lamb. Then the priest will take some of its blood and put it on the tip of the right ear of the person being cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand:
verses.web: The priest shall pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand;
verses.ct: The priest will pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD:
verses.web: and the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before LORD.
verses.ct: With his right finger, the priest will sprinkle some of the oil from his left hand 7 times before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the trespass offering:
verses.web: Then the priest shall put some of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, on the place of the blood of the trespass offering.
verses.ct: Then the priest will put some of the oil from his hand on the tip of the right ear of the person being cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot — on the same spots where the blood of the guilt offering was placed.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an atonement for him before the LORD.
verses.web: The rest of the oil that is in the priest’s hand he shall put on the head of him who is to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before LORD.
verses.ct: Whatever oil remains in the priest's hand, he will put on the head of the person being cleansed, to make atonement for them before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer the one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, such as he can get;
verses.web: He shall offer one of the turtledoves, or of the young pigeons, which ever he is able to afford,
verses.ct: Then he will offer one of the turtledoves or young pigeons — whichever the person could afford —

verses.kjv: Even such as he is able to get, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, with the meat offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed before the LORD.
verses.web: of the kind he is able to afford, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, with the meal offering. The priest shall make atonement for him who is to be cleansed before LORD.”
verses.ct: one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, along with the grain offering. In this way the priest will make atonement before the LORD for the person being cleansed."

verses.kjv: This is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose hand is not able to get that which pertaineth to his cleansing.
verses.web: This is the law for him in whom is the plague of leprosy, who is not able to afford the sacrifice for his cleansing.
verses.ct: This is the procedure for anyone with a skin disease who cannot afford the full offerings required for their cleansing.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron and said,

verses.kjv: When ye be come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;
verses.web: “When you have come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put a spreading mildew in a house in the land of your possession,
verses.ct: "When you enter the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as your own, and I cause a contamination to appear in a house in that land,

verses.kjv: And he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, It seemeth to me there is as it were a plague in the house:
verses.web: then he who owns the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, ‘There seems to me to be some sort of plague in the house.’
verses.ct: the owner of the house must go to the priest and report, 'There seems to be some kind of contamination in my house.'

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest go into it to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made unclean: and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house:
verses.web: The priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest goes in to examine the plague, that all that is in the house not be made unclean. Afterward the priest shall go in to inspect the house.
verses.ct: Before the priest goes in to examine the contamination, he will order the house emptied so that nothing inside becomes unclean. After that, the priest will go in to inspect the house.

verses.kjv: And he shall look on the plague, and, behold, if the plague be in the walls of the house with hollow strakes, greenish or reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall;
verses.web: He shall examine the plague; and behold, if the plague is in the walls of the house with hollow streaks, greenish or reddish, and it appears to be deeper than the wall,
verses.ct: He will examine the contamination. If there are greenish or reddish streaks in the walls that appear to go deeper than the surface,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days:
verses.web: then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days.
verses.ct: the priest will leave the house, go to the doorway, and quarantine the house for 7 days.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look: and, behold, if the plague be spread in the walls of the house;
verses.web: The priest shall come again on the seventh day, and look. If the plague has spread in the walls of the house,
verses.ct: On the 7th day, the priest will return and inspect it again. If the contamination has spread in the walls,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall command that they take away the stones in which the plague is, and they shall cast them into an unclean place without the city:
verses.web: then the priest shall command that they take out the stones in which is the plague, and cast them into an unclean place outside of the city.
verses.ct: the priest will order the infected stones removed and thrown into an unclean area outside the city.

verses.kjv: And he shall cause the house to be scraped within round about, and they shall pour out the dust that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place:
verses.web: He shall cause the inside of the house to be scraped all over. They shall pour out the mortar that they scraped off outside of the city into an unclean place.
verses.ct: He will have the entire interior of the house scraped, and all the scraped-off plaster must be dumped in an unclean area outside the city.

verses.kjv: And they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other morter, and shall plaister the house.
verses.web: They shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.
verses.ct: New stones will be put in place of the old ones, and the house will be replastered with fresh mortar.

verses.kjv: And if the plague come again, and break out in the house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the house, and after it is plaistered;
verses.web: “If the plague comes again, and breaks out in the house after he has taken out the stones, and after he has scraped the house, and after it was plastered,
verses.ct: "If the contamination comes back and breaks out in the house after the stones have been removed, the walls scraped, and the house replastered,

verses.kjv: Then the priest shall come and look, and, behold, if the plague be spread in the house, it is a fretting leprosy in the house: it is unclean.
verses.web: then the priest shall come in and look; and behold, if the plague has spread in the house, it is a destructive mildew in the house. It is unclean.
verses.ct: the priest must come and inspect it. If the contamination has spread, it is a destructive mildew in the house. The house is unclean.

verses.kjv: And he shall break down the house, the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the morter of the house; and he shall carry them forth out of the city into an unclean place.
verses.web: He shall break down the house, its stones, and its timber, and all the house’s mortar. He shall carry them out of the city into an unclean place.
verses.ct: The house must be torn down — its stones, its timber, and all its plaster — and everything must be hauled to an unclean area outside the city.

verses.kjv: Moreover he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up shall be unclean until the even.
verses.web: “Moreover he who goes into the house while it is shut up shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.ct: "Anyone who enters the house while it is quarantined will be unclean until evening.

verses.kjv: And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes; and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.
verses.web: He who lies down in the house shall wash his clothes; and he who eats in the house shall wash his clothes.
verses.ct: Anyone who sleeps in the house must wash their clothes. Anyone who eats in the house must wash their clothes.

verses.kjv: And if the priest shall come in, and look upon it, and, behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plaistered: then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
verses.web: “If the priest shall come in, and examine it, and behold, the plague hasn’t spread in the house, after the house was plastered, then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
verses.ct: "But if the priest comes to inspect and finds that the contamination has not spread after the house was replastered, the priest will declare the house clean, because the contamination is gone.

verses.kjv: And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:
verses.web: To cleanse the house he shall take two birds, cedar wood, scarlet, and hyssop.
verses.ct: To purify the house, he will take 2 birds, cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop.

verses.kjv: And he shall kill the one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water:
verses.web: He shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.
verses.ct: He will kill one of the birds over a clay pot filled with fresh running water.

verses.kjv: And he shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times:
verses.web: He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
verses.ct: Then he will take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn, and the living bird, dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and in the running water, and sprinkle the house 7 times.

verses.kjv: And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet:
verses.web: He shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, with the living bird, with the cedar wood, with the hyssop, and with the scarlet;
verses.ct: He will purify the house using the bird's blood, the running water, the living bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn.

verses.kjv: But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shall be clean.
verses.web: but he shall let the living bird go out of the city into the open field. So shall he make atonement for the house; and it shall be clean.”
verses.ct: Then he will release the living bird outside the city into the open field. In this way he will make atonement for the house, and it will be clean."

verses.kjv: This is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and scall,
verses.web: This is the law for any plague of leprosy, and for an itch,
verses.ct: These are the instructions for every kind of skin disease and scaly infection,

verses.kjv: And for the leprosy of a garment, and of a house,
verses.web: and for the destructive mildew of a garment, and for a house,
verses.ct: for mildew in clothing and in houses,

verses.kjv: And for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot:
verses.web: and for a swelling, and for a scab, and for a bright spot;
verses.ct: and for swellings, rashes, and shiny spots on the skin —

verses.kjv: To teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean: this is the law of leprosy.
verses.web: to teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean. This is the law of leprosy.
verses.ct: to determine when something is unclean and when it is clean. This is the complete set of instructions regarding skin diseases.
